item.title: Report E-2024100189
item.description:
Report E-2024100189

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-09T09:22:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-05
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XHG experienced a UN3082 Surfonic JL-80X release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 4’ x 4’ area of the trailer floor, and a 15' x 8' area of the concrete lot below. The drum was punctured by a forklift. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon metal overpack. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted area. The impacted absorbents were then containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024100491
item.description:
Report X-2024100491

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-09T09:22:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-30
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT NEEDED TO BE REWRAPPED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED EIGHT X 1.7 OUNCE AEROSOLS OF NON-FLAMMABLE EVIAN FACIAL SPRAYS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2024100196
item.description:
Report E-2024100196

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-09T09:22:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-10
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 17:44 PM ET, XPO - XHG contacted the call center to report a spill which was found inside of trailer. The spill was approximately 1 pound of Lithium Hydroxide Monohydrate which released from (2) 55-pound paper bag due to a forklift puncture from a prior terminal. Contractors overpacked the (2) 55-pound bags of Lithium Hydroxide Monohydrate, impacted PPE and rags into (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024100355
item.description:
Report X-2024100355

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-24
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 12 HOUR RESPONDER REBOXING PKGS THAT WERE WET FROM A LEAKER THAT WAS AT DOOR 35 IN THE UNLOAD. RESPONDER OPENED THE PKG, REMOVED THE FIRST OF THE TWO UNDAMAGED BOXES, AND NOTICED THAT THERE WAS A CLASS 1.4S EXPLOSIVE DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL ON THE SIDE OF THE INNER CARTON. RESPONDER REALIZED THAT THE PKG WAS AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT, AND THE SHIPMENT WAS PHONED INTO HMSC. OUTER CARTON WET ON THE BOTTOM, BUT THE 2 BOXES CONTAINING THE PRODUCT WERE UNDAMAGED.

item.title: Report E-2024100141
item.description:
Report E-2024100141

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-05
  • City: WILKES BARRE TOWNSHIP
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 38000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: At 1739ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release located at terminal XWB. It was reported that an unknown amount of Acid N released from (1) 275-gallon poly tote due to puncture from the metal part of a strap. The release is impacting the trailer floor, is releasing heavily, and starting to leak out onto the concrete yard. Terminal personnel are putting speedy dry around the release to try to contain it. The caller reported the tote is punctured on the side about 4" from the bottom and will be empty by the time a contractor arrives on site. Contractors recovered Acid N product, impacted absorbents, pads, and plastic in (18) 55-gallon poly drums. The drums were staged onsite at the terminal for personnel to handle.

  • Description: The KAG Specialty Products Group, LLC unit was in transit carrying a load of resin solution. A wash out cap on the trailer was loose and allowed approximately 20 gallons of resin solution to be released. Enviroserve responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report E-2024100054
item.description:
Report E-2024100054

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-04T12:22:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-01
  • City: NEW COLUMBIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XMI experienced a UN2815 Aminoethylpiperazine-HP release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 25-gallons of product released to an 8' x 15' area of the trailer floor and a 6' x 28' area of the concrete and asphalt lot below. The drum was punctured by a pallet nail puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents and simple green were then utilized to clean the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents, pallet wood, and cleanup debris were containerized into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
